Andrea Goethals wrote:
> While we're talking time -- the first column in the crawl.log is formatted
> to look like UTC time (has the "Z" character at end) but at least in the
> ARCs I am importing the time is really in my local time (EST) so I have to
> muck with it to get it in the real time. Was this also fixed post 1.8?

Heritrix asks the system for its time using standard Java functions, 
then asks to format that time as a GMT time. With the behavior you're 
seeing, some aspect of your host system may be confused into thinking 
that (1) it is in GMT; and (2) it thinks GMT time is EST.

If the system is misconfigured and you can't change it, you *might* be 
able to work around the system via the Java 'user.timezone' property.

- Gordon @ IA
